item.title: Euclidean Isometries of Graphs
item.description: Motivation Last year, I became interested in (approximate) isometric embeddings of graphs with the path distance metric into metric spaces whose elements can be represented by coordinates - like \(N \)-dimensional euclidean space , \( \mathbb{E}^N \). Let’s consider an isometric mapping from a graph with a path distance metric to n-dimensional euclidean space for instance: \( f: G \rightarrow \mathbb{E}^N \). Isometric means that the distances between each two vertices \(v, w \in G\) is preserved by \(f\), i.
